text.section: The powers of each authority are vested in the commissioners.

A quorum is:
three commissioners of a five-member authority;
four commissioners of a seven-member authority; or
five commissioners of a nine-member authority.
An authority may take action on a vote of a majority of the commissioners present at a meeting at which there is a quorum, unless a larger number is required by law or the bylaws of the authority.
